intro: Thryptomene hyporhytis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf thryptomene, is a small shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Thryptomene hyporhytis is well adapted to sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal dunes.
